title: Fractional Real Estate Ownership( RWAs +NFT) on Cardano
summary: Real estate assets are hard to access due to high capital, slow transactions, fraud risks, and limited investor access, especially in emerging markets, where most people cannot participate.
solution: RareA enables fractional, tokenized real estate assets on Cardano, letting small and global investors access, trade, and earn from properties with secure, transparent blockchain ownership.
proposer_relevant_experience:
1.Name: Precious Agamuyi(CEO)-Project Lead.

Precious Agamuyi is the Founder and CEO of Alive Home, an emerging real estate marketplace transforming how Nigerians discover, verify, and secure trusted properties. He is a passionate entrepreneur dedicated to solving long-standing challenges in the real estate sector, especially fraud, lack of transparency, and unreliable property information.

Through Alive Home, Precious is building an innovative, technology-driven ecosystem that connects homebuyers, property owners, realtors, and developers with verified listings, smarter search tools, and secure interactions.

With over 7 years of experience as a software engineer, he leverages his strong technical background to design and lead scalable solutions that bring trust, clarity, and efficiency to Nigeria’s property market.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
RareA introduces a new model on Cardano by enabling fully compliant fractional ownership of real-world properties with automated revenue distribution and on-chain legal backing. While tokenized assets exist in other ecosystems, Cardano has not yet deployed a comprehensive solution that combines legal SPV-based property structuring, identity-verified investing, rental-income automation, and secondary token liquidity in one integrated platform.

What makes RareA innovative on Cardano:

1. End-to-End Real Estate Tokenization Workflow

Unlike existing solutions that focus only on NFTs or token minting, RareA provides a complete lifecycle:

o	Property verification and tokenization

o	On-chain ownership registry

o	Automated rental income distribution

o	Investor reporting and liquidation logic

1. Legally Compliant Asset Structuring

Each property is secured through SPVs and regulatory frameworks, ensuring that tokens represent real, legal ownership, not just speculative digital assets.

1. Income Automation via Smart Contracts

Rental income and profit-sharing are distributed automatically to investors based on token holdings, reducing operational costs and ensuring transparency.

1. A Liquid Marketplace for Real Estate Shares

RareA creates a secondary market where investors can exit positions without waiting for property resale, solving one of the biggest limitations of real estate investing: illiquidity.

1. Designed for Emerging Markets

The platform specifically opens real estate investing to users in Nigeria, Africa, and other regions where:

o	Capital barriers are high

o	Access to secure property documentation is limited

o	Investment infrastructure is weak

1. Improving Upon Previous Approaches

Rather than repeating traditional NFT/property listing models, RareA:

o	Links real-world assets to verifiable legal entities

o	Uses auditable on-chain ownership records

o	Provides transparent, trustless income flow

o	Enables borderless participation with identity compliance

By combining smart contracts, regulatory compliance, fractionalization, and marketplace liquidity, RareA transforms real estate from a slow, high-capital, illiquid investment into a transparent, accessible, and tradable asset class on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The RareA MVP will deliver a working prototype of fractional real estate tokenization on Cardano, demonstrating how a physical property can be represented, purchased, owned, and rewarded through Cardano native assets. The prototype will validate the technical foundation required for a full production system.



By the end of the funding cycle, the MVP will be deployed on the Cardano testnet and will include the following functional components:



What the MVP Will Demonstrate



On-Chain Property Tokenization

A real or example property will be converted into fractional ownership represented as Cardano native tokens. Token and asset metadata will be stored on-chain, proving asset registration and tracing ownership transparently.



Smart Contract–Driven Investment Flow

Users will be able to:



Connect a testnet Cardano wallet



Purchase fractional tokens



See their updated ownership instantly on-chain



This proves that real estate shares can be issued and transferred trustlessly without manual intermediaries.



Automated Income Distribution

The MVP will simulate rental income or asset yield and automatically distribute it to token holders through a Cardano smart contract. Each investor receives their share proportionally based on holdings, with payouts visible on-chain.



Ownership & Portfolio Dashboard

A simple web interface will allow users to:



View property details



See the number of fractions owned



Monitor payout history and transactions



Verify on-chain references through blockchain explorers



This ensures clarity, usability, and real-world investment visibility.



Auditable On-Chain Registry

All ownership transfers, distributions, and property metadata will be fully traceable using public Cardano explorers—providing transparent reporting suitable for regulators, users, and auditors.



Deployment



The MVP will be accessible through:



A public web application connected to Cardano testnet



A GitHub repository containing:



Smart contract code



Web frontend source code



Deployment instructions



Documentation for testers and developers



How the Community Can Test



The Cardano community will be invited to:



Connect a testnet wallet (e.g., Lace, Eternl, NuFi)



Acquire fractional ownership tokens



Observe automated token-based payouts



Review all logic on the blockchain



Submit feedback through:



GitHub Issues



Discord/Telegram channels



Catalyst comment threads



Testing will help validate:



Smart contract correctness



System stability and gas efficiency



User experience and clarity



Ease of onboarding for non-technical participants



Quality of documentation



Expected Outcome



By the end of this phase, the prototype will prove:



Real estate assets can be tokenized and fractionalized on Cardano



Ownership transfers can occur instantly and transparently



Yield distribution can be automated end-to-end



Users can independently verify ownership and payouts without relying on centralized systems



A functional foundation exists for scaling toward mainnet deployment and regulatory integration



This MVP lays the groundwork for transforming real estate into an accessible, blockchain-powered financial product on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
RareA will measure its success using verifiable blockchain-based indicators and transparent adoption metrics. All projections are grounded in current Cardano network capabilities and realistic industry benchmarks in Real-World Asset (RWA) tokenization.

Expected Blockchain Usage & Adoption Metrics

Year 1 – MVP Deployment & User Acquisition

•	1,500–3,000 registered platform users

•	250–700 active investors

•	15–25 tokenized property assets

•	10,000–40,000 monthly smart-contract transactions, including:

o	Fractional ownership minting and transfers

o	Rental income distributions

o	Investor governance and voting

•	$500K–$2M Total Property Value Locked (TPVL) on-chain

Year 2 – Expansion

•	7,000–18,000 registered users

•	1,500–4,000 active investors

•	80–200 tokenized properties live

•	80,000–320,000 monthly smart-contract calls

•	$5M–$20M TPVL

Year 3 – Scaling Across Regions

•	30,000–80,000 registered users

•	8,000–20,000 active investors

•	300–600 real estate assets tokenized

•	300,000–1.2M monthly smart-contract interactions

•	$35M–$120M TPVL

Alignment with Cardano Network Capacity

These projections remain realistic because:

•	Cardano processes millions of transactions daily, and RareA’s expected volumes represent less than 0.03% of typical network throughput.

•	Similar growth curves have been observed in emerging Cardano DeFi/RWA platforms.

•	UTXO-based contract architecture and low fees (typically 0.1–0.2 ADA per transaction) allow sustainable scaling.

On-Chain KPIs (Fully Auditable)

The following success indicators will be visible and verifiable using Cardano explorers:

•	Number of tokenized real estate assets minted

•	Unique wallet addresses holding ownership tokens

•	Smart-contract invocation count (buy/sell actions, distributions, DAO votes)

•	Total value locked in properties and liquidity pools

•	DAO participation rate in governance decisions

Supporting Operational KPIs (Off-Chain)

Additional performance indicators will include:

•	Monthly onboarding of estate partners (brokers, developers, landlords)

•	Average investment per user

•	Tokenized asset liquidity time (how fast shares are sold)

•	User retention and reinvestment frequency

•	Regulatory compliance milestones per region

Reporting & Transparency Approach

RareA commits to:

•	Publishing public adoption dashboards powered by on-chain data

•	Annual reports for financial, regulatory, and platform progress

•	Adjusting projections as real data becomes available – no inflated growth claims

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
RareA delivers a blockchain-based real estate investment platform that tokenizes physical property into tradable fractional ownership on Cardano. The proposal focuses on developing the core platform modules that enable secure property onboarding, fractionalization, ownership management, and on-chain yield distribution.



Our solution uses Cardano smart contracts to convert real properties into regulated digital tokens, allowing users to buy fractions instead of entire buildings. This removes the high capital entry barrier and makes property investing affordable, liquid, transparent, and globally accessible. Each token represents a legally backed ownership share, and all rental income, appreciation, and governance activity can be recorded and executed on-chain.



Why We Approach It This Way

Traditional property investment is expensive, paperwork-heavy, slow, and inaccessible to average people, especially in emerging markets. Records are centralized, difficult to verify, and cannot be traded easily. By tokenizing property on Cardano, ownership becomes transparent, affordable, instant to verify, and tradable in small units. Cardano’s low fees, EUTXO model, native tokens, and regulated identity standards make it a strong foundation for real-world asset deployment.



What This Proposal Will Build

With Catalyst funding, RareA will deliver the following core system components:



Property Tokenization Module



Smart contracts for registering verified real estate assets



Legal metadata binding property documents to on-chain tokens



Fractional minting and issuance of ownership tokens



Ownership & Compliance Layer



Wallet-based user onboarding



KYC/AML identity integration for regulated participation



Automated ownership transfer rules



Yield Distribution Engine



Smart contracts for proportional payout of rental income or asset appreciation



On-chain reporting with auditable logs



Secondary Marketplace Foundation



Peer-to-peer transfer function for reselling fractions



Pricing and transaction settlement mechanisms



Governance Framework



Token-based voting system for investor decision-making



Property-level DAO configuration



Who the Project Will Engage



Retail investors seeking affordable, fractional property ownership



Property owners and developers wanting alternative fundraising liquidity



Diaspora and cross-border investors unable to participate today



Real estate agencies onboarding verified property inventory



Regulators and legal partners for compliant asset issuance



Cardano community members for testing, governance, and adoption



What Makes RareA Unique

RareA is designed specifically for real estate accessibility in markets where financial inclusion is weakest. The platform offers:



True fractional ownership backed by enforceable legal rights



Automated real-yield distribution directly to user wallets



DAO-based property governance



Full end-to-end lifecycle (onboarding → tokenization → ownership → income → resale)



Regulatory-ready smart contracts and identity binding



A system that links real-world property transfer with blockchain verification



How We Will Demonstrate Impact

Progress will be tracked through both on-chain and operational KPIs:



On-chain metrics:



Number of tokenized properties issued



Count of wallets holding investment fractions



Transaction and smart contract activity



Recorded rental income payouts



Total Value Locked (TVL)



Participation in property governance votes



Operational metrics:



Property partners and developers onboarded



User growth and repeat participation



Reduction in time required to complete ownership settlement



Investor diversity and representation, especially underserved demographics



Capital deployed through the platform



Dashboards based on Cardano explorers and analytics tools will provide public, transparent reporting.



Why This Matters to Cardano

Real estate is a $300 trillion market. Even small-scale adoption significantly increases on-chain settlement volume, token circulation, wallet growth, and enterprise adoption. RareA demonstrates Cardano as a capable infrastructure for large-scale regulated financial systems, driving:



New users and liquidity into Cardano



Real-world economic value backed by actual assets



Enterprise credibility for governments, real estate institutions, and global markets



Expansion of Cardano’s position as a preferred chain for real-world assets



RareA converts real estate from a slow, exclusive, manual process into a blockchain-powered financial product that is global, transparent, accessible, and user-controlled—all anchored on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
RareA delivers a production-ready implementation of legally-compliant fractional real estate tokenization on Cardano, directly advancing the blockchain's real-world asset (RWA) capabilities and demonstrating enterprise-grade utility to attract institutional adoption.

1. Strategic Value to the Cardano Ecosystem

RareA addresses Strategic Fit, Feasibility, and impact, the three core evaluation criteria, by building critical RWA infrastructure that positions Cardano competitively in a market projected to reach $2 trillion by 2030.

Immediate Ecosystem Benefits:

•	Technical Leadership: Provides the first open-source, legally-integrated fractional property ownership system on Cardano, filling a documented gap in the ecosystem's RWA tooling

•	Developer Enablement: Delivers reusable smart contract primitives, legal templates, and integration patterns that dramatically reduce time-to-market for future RWA builders

•	EUTXO Validation: Demonstrates Cardano's technical advantages for regulated financial systems through deterministic transaction handling and built-in compliance logic

•	Network Effects: Attracts real estate developers, institutional investors, and compliance-focused builders to explore Cardano as their RWA platform

•	Regulatory Positioning: Establishes precedent for legally-compliant tokenization, making Cardano more attractive to enterprise partners requiring regulatory certainty

Competitive Differentiation: Similar successful Cardano RWA projects like Empowa and CSWAP have demonstrated real-world adoption and industrial use-case partnerships, validating market demand. RareA extends this foundation with purpose-built real estate fractionalization, a high-value segment currently dominated by Ethereum-based solutions.

1. Measurable Impact and Success Metrics

Success will be tracked through concrete, verifiable on-chain data and community engagement metrics that align with Catalyst's requirement for tangible, measurable evidence.

Primary Success Indicators:

Testnet Activity

•	20,000–30,000 transactions demonstrating platform functionality

•	5,000–10,000 fractional ownership tokens minted across test properties

•	2,000–4,000 unique wallet addresses interacting with contracts

•	800–1,500 simulated revenue distribution events

•	1,000–2,000 DAO governance interactions (proposals, votes, delegations)

Community Adoption Metrics

•	1,500–3,000 registered platform users completing KYC simulation

•	400–800 active community testers providing structured feedback

•	200–400 GitHub engagements (stars, forks, code contributions)

•	100–200 detailed feedback submissions via established channels

•	8–15 ecosystem partnerships or integration commitments

Knowledge Transfer Impact

•	5–10 technical workshops/presentations at Cardano community events

•	3–5 published case studies demonstrating implementation patterns

•	Documentation page views and developer onboarding completions tracked monthly

Benchmark Context: These targets align with successful Cardano testnet launches like CSWAP's RWA expansion and Empowa's NSE tokenization pilot, which demonstrated measurable traction before mainnet deployment. Our conservative estimates reflect realistic MVP adoption while providing clear success thresholds.

1. Open Knowledge Sharing and Ecosystem Growth

All project outputs will be publicly accessible to maximize learning impact and accelerate ecosystem development, directly supporting Catalyst's emphasis on properly engaging and communicating with the community.

Technical Resources (Open Source - Apache 2.0)

•	Complete smart contract repository with comprehensive test coverage

•	Frontend application code and deployment documentation

•	Legal compliance framework templates adaptable to different jurisdictions

•	Integration guides for wallet providers, identity systems, and oracles

•	Architectural decision records explaining design trade-offs

Educational Content

•	Step-by-step tutorials: Building RWA Applications on Cardano

•	Video walkthrough series covering the end-to-end tokenization process

•	Live developer workshops with Q&A sessions

•	Written case study analyzing legal, technical, and UX challenges

Community Testing Infrastructure

•	Public testnet access with pre-funded test wallets

•	Discord/Telegram support channels with dedicated office hours

•	Structured feedback forms capturing both quantitative and qualitative data

•	Bug bounty program encouraging security research

Transparency and Accountability

•	Public impact dashboard showing real-time testnet metrics

•	Monthly progress reports published on Cardano Forum

•	Detailed project closeout report including lessons learned, recommendations for mainnet migration, and identified areas for future research

•	Open financial accounting of Catalyst fund utilization

Long-term Ecosystem Benefit: By providing both working code and comprehensive documentation, RareA reduces the technical and legal barriers preventing other teams from building RWA solutions on Cardano. This multiplies the project's impact beyond our direct deliverables, contributing to the target for Catalyst-funded projects, resulting in real-world adoption or industrial partnerships.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team has the technical, real estate, operational, and delivery capability to execute this project with a high level of trust, accountability, and transparency.

I lead the project as a real estate-focused technology founder and CEO of Alive Home, an active real estate marketplace addressing fraud, transparency, and verification challenges across Nigeria’s property market. Through Alive Home, I have direct leadership experience working with agents, developers, property owners, and regulatory stakeholders. This domain knowledge ensures our solution is grounded in practical market needs, user behaviour, compliance considerations, and the realities of property transactions in emerging markets.

**Our team also includes deep technical talent:**

•	The project is led by a Senior Backend Engineer with years of experience designing and shipping production-grade software systems, microservices architectures, and scalable fintech and platform applications. I have successfully delivered complex projects in regulated environments and currently lead engineering teams, ensuring that technical execution is aligned with business, security, and compliance requirements.

•	We have a blockchain developer with proven experience building and deploying smart contracts and applications on the Cardano blockchain. This ensures the project is not theoretical—our team already possesses practical Cardano development capability and has experience working with real-world blockchain tools, libraries, and on-chain deployment processes.

Structured delivery approach (industry best practices)

We follow a structured delivery approach that provides traceability, measurable progress, and community visibility:

**Defined project scope and milestones**

The MVP will be executed in planned development sprints with clear deliverables such as smart contracts, tokenization logic, web interface, and testnet deployment. This provides measurable progress and traceability.

•	Transparent development process

All source code, smart contracts, documentation, and deployment scripts will be stored in a public GitHub repository. Commits, changes, and updates will be visible to the community throughout development.

•	Community-testable product

The MVP will be deployed to the Cardano testnet, and the community will be able to:

• Connect a testnet wallet

• Acquire fractional tokens

• Experience automated distribution and on-chain functionality

• Provide open feedback

This ensures that feasibility is validated openly, not only internally.

Technical feasibility validation

Feasibility and performance will be validated through concrete, verifiable tests:

•	Successful smart contract deployment and execution on testnet.

•	Fractional tokens minted and transferable on-chain.

•	Automated payout execution and verifiable transaction logs.

•	User journeys tested through the web dashboard.

•	Stress testing interactions and transaction throughput.

All results will be verifiable on Cardano explorers.

**Financial accountability and responsible fund management**

We will manage Catalyst funds with strict transparency and evidence-based disbursement:

•	Budget breakdowns will be shared publicly.

•	Milestone completion will be evidenced by testnet deployment, video walkthroughs, GitHub commits, and documentation.

•	No funds will be drawn down without meeting stated milestone deliverables.

•	Spending will be trackable through periodic update reports submitted to Catalyst.

**Professional development and delivery standards**

As technical leaders, we apply rigorous engineering standards to ensure maintainability, auditability, and robustness:

•	Secure API and backend development

•	Designing distributed systems

•	Production operations and uptime management

•	Continuous integration and deployment pipelines (CI/CD)

•	Code quality assurance, automated testing, and peer review

These standards will be applied to the RareA implementation to ensure maintainability, auditability, and robustness.

**Strong motivation for long\-term delivery**

This project directly aligns with our vision to expand Cardano’s real-world use cases, especially across emerging markets where financial access is limited. We are not testing an idea, we are developing infrastructure that can evolve into a fully compliant, production-grade RWA investment platform. Our motivation is long-term: to build real infrastructure that scales, serves communities, and unlocks new markets for tokenized real-world assets.

Why our team is best suited to deliver

•	Deep experience in backend engineering, fintech platforms, and production systems.

•	Proven Cardano development skills within the team.

•	Professional software delivery processes already in place.

•	Hands-on real estate leadership and marketplace experience (Alive Home), strong ties to agents, developers, owners, and market stakeholders.

•	A commitment to transparent development, community involvement, and measurable outcomes.

By combining real-world real estate leadership and domain knowledge with disciplined software engineering and blockchain development experience, we are well-equipped to deliver a working, publicly testable solution that demonstrates technical feasibility, operational viability, and responsible fund stewardship.

sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
RareA will build the backend services required to interact with the smart contracts, including:

•	API services for token minting, purchasing, wallet validation, and investor identity linkage

•	Smart contract integration for automated rental/return distribution

•	Storage and indexing of on-chain data for UI and user reporting

•	Backend ledger for yield simulation and distribution logic

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
•	API endpoints are operational and connected to the Cardano testnet

•	Simulated rental revenue automatically calculated and distributed

•	Distribution events reflected on-chain

•	Backend infrastructure can list, query, and verify tokenized properties

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
•	API documentation (Swagger/Redoc or similar)

•	Testnet transaction IDs showing yield distribution

•	Backend code in GitHub

•	Screenshots or logs of successful end-to-end execution

sub_fields.answer: Web Dashboard (MVP User Interface)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
RareA will develop a publicly accessible web dashboard where users can:

•	Connect a Cardano testnet wallet (Eternl, Lace, NuFi, etc.)

•	View available tokenized real estate

•	Purchase fractional tokens

•	View ownership status and distribution history

•	Verify property data pulled from-chain

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
•	Web dashboard deployed publicly

•	Wallet connection is working reliably

•	Users can interact with RareA smart contracts via the UI

•	Ownership and distributions are visible in the user interface for tracking and keeping

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
•	Hosted web application link

•	GitHub source for frontend

•	Screenshots or screen recording of the full process

•	Live connection to testnet smart contracts

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
RareA will open the MVP to public testnet users and gather ecosystem-wide feedback. Deliverables include:

•	Public testnet access for the Cardano community

•	Testing guides and onboarding instructions

•	Feedback collection via Catalyst comments, GitHub Issues, Discord groups, etc.

•	Final project report including performance insights, technical results, and roadmap to mainnet

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
•	Testers can connect wallets and complete full investment flows

•	Feedback channels are active with community participation

•	Final documentation published outlining outcomes, challenges, and next steps

•	End-to-end MVP proven feasible

sub_fields.title: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.description: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.answer:
1.Name: Precious Agamuyi(CEO)-Project Lead.

Precious Agamuyi is the Founder and CEO of Alive Home, an emerging real estate marketplace transforming how Nigerians discover, verify, and secure trusted properties. He is a passionate entrepreneur dedicated to solving long-standing challenges in the real estate sector, especially fraud, lack of transparency, and unreliable property information.

Through Alive Home, Precious is building an innovative, technology-driven ecosystem that connects homebuyers, property owners, realtors, and developers with verified listings, smarter search tools, and secure interactions.

With over 7 years of experience as a software engineer, he leverages his strong technical background to design and lead scalable solutions that bring trust, clarity, and efficiency to Nigeria’s property market.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
1. Smart Contract Architecture & Tokenization Engine (45,000 ADA)

Resources Covered

•	Smart contract development (Plutus / Aiken)

•	Tokenization logic implementation

•	Legal token model design and compliance requirements

•	Testnet deployment setup

•	Internal QA and security checks

Cost Details

•	Lead Blockchain Engineer (Primary contract developer): 25,000 ADA

•	Technical Architect / Compliance Consultant: 10,000 ADA

•	Internal QA & Testing: 5,000 ADA

•	Documentation & DevOps deployment work: 5,000 ADA

2. Backend Platform & Automated Distribution Engine (55,000 ADA)

Resources Covered

•	Backend microservices development

•	API development for wallet interaction, distribution logic, identity linking

•	Smart contract integration

•	Backend database and indexing services

•	Automated simulated rental distribution logic

Cost Details

•	Senior Backend Engineer (Node.js / Rust): 30,000 ADA

•	Blockchain Integration Developer: 10,000 ADA

•	Infrastructure & Hosting Setup: 5,000 ADA

•	Automated Testing, CI/CD, monitoring setup: 5,000 ADA

•	Documentation & security hardening: 5,000 ADA

3. Web Dashboard (User Interface) (35,000 ADA)

Resources Covered

•	Fully functional UI connected to the Cardano testnet

•	Wallet connection (Lace, Eternl, NuFi compatibility)

•	Property listing pages

•	On-chain portfolio tracking

•	Transaction history and investor interface

Cost Details

•	Front-end Developer (React/Vue/Svelte): 20,000 ADA

•	UI/UX Designer Improvement: 7,000 ADA

•	API integration work: 5,000 ADA

•	Front-end testing and hosting: 3,000 ADA

4. Public Testnet Launch, Community Testing & Final Documentation (15,000 ADA)

Resources Covered

•	Public testnet deployment

•	Onboarding guides

•	Video walkthroughs & usage instructions

•	Community tester support

•	Catalyst reporting and final delivery documentation

Cost Details

•	Project Lead (Testing coordination & documentation): 7,000 ADA

•	Community support & communication management: 4,000 ADA

•	Production of guides, documentation, demo content: 2,000 ADA

•	Final analysis & reporting: 2,000 ADA

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
RareA delivers a fully functional, open, and reusable RWA prototype on Cardano, covering smart contracts, backend infrastructure, frontend interface, automated income distribution, testnet deployment, developer documentation, and community testing, for 150,000 ADA. This represents excellent value for the ecosystem, as the budget is narrowly focused on components that directly produce measurable on-chain activity and reusable RWA infrastructure.

The cost is justified by the highly technical nature of the work. Developing secure real-estate tokenization flows, Plutus/Aiken smart contracts, automated yield distribution, and proof-based ownership systems requires senior-level blockchain engineering. Industry-standard rates for blockchain engineers typically range from $40–$150+ per hour, and full blockchain MVP builds often cost $20,000–$250,000+, depending on complexity. Within this context, a 150,000 ADA budget (~mid-range MVP cost) is a conservative request for delivering a complete, testable RWA prototype.

Catalyst precedents demonstrate that larger budgets have historically been allocated for RWA infrastructure. For example, teams like CSWAP Systems, ChainCrib, and other Cardano RWA-focused initiatives have received or requested significantly higher amounts, validating that the ecosystem recognizes the complexity and value of funding regulated, real-world financial applications. RareA continues this trajectory by offering a targeted, builder-friendly RWA implementation designed from the start to be reused by future ecosystem projects.

The allocation of funds is also highly efficient. Rather than being spread across marketing, ideation, or exploratory research, the budget is focused almost entirely on senior engineering, smart-contract development, backend integration, UI implementation, and public testnet deployment. These are the components that produce real value on-chain and accelerate Cardano’s position within the rapidly expanding tokenized-assets market.

Additionally, all outputs, contracts, templates, integration guides, identity workflows, and APIs will be fully open-source, reducing development costs for other teams and allowing Catalyst to benefit repeatedly from a single investment. This creates ecosystem-wide leverage and multiplies the long-term value of the initial funding.

Finally, transparency is guaranteed through milestone-based releases, testnet deployment, GitHub commits, public demos, and verifiable on-chain transaction IDs, giving Catalyst voters complete visibility into the project’s progress and ensuring responsible, accountable fund usage.

What 1 ADA Delivers (5-Year Value Breakdown)

Based on moderate, realistic adoption projections from prior Cardano MVPs, RareA is expected to generate between 250,000–350,000 on-chain transactions and onboard 30,000–50,000 users within 5 years (testnet + mainnet rollout).

1 ADA = Real, Measurable Ecosystem Impact

Category	5-Year Projection	Cost per Unit (150,000 ADA)

On-chain transactions generated	250,000 – 350,000	0.43 – 0.60 ADA per transaction

Users onboarded / interacting	30,000 – 50,000	3 – 5 ADA per user

Developers reusing open-source components	200 – 400	375 – 750 ADA per developer

Governance & token-holder actions	15,000 – 25,000	6 – 10 ADA per action

Interpretation of Value

•	For less than 1 ADA, the Cardano network gains a real, measurable on-chain RWA transaction.

•	For 3–5 ADA, a new user is onboarded into the Cardano ecosystem.

•	For 375–750 ADA, an entire developer team gains access to reusable RWA smart-contract templates and technical documentation.

•	Each governance cycle costs only 6–10 ADA, supporting decentralized ownership models.

This cost-per-impact ratio is exceptionally competitive. Comparable RWA prototypes built on other blockchains (Polygon, Avalanche, Ethereum L2s) typically require 3–5× higher funding, demonstrating that RareA delivers far more measurable value per unit of funding.

sub_fields.title: I confirm that evidence of prior research, whitepaper, design, or proof-of-concept is provided.
sub_fields.description: Foundational Work:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes ecosystem research and uses the findings to either (a) justify its uniqueness over existing solutions or (b) demonstrate the value of its novel approach.
sub_fields.description: Ecosystem Value Proposition:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal demonstrates technical capability via verifiable in-house talent or a confirmed development partner (GitHub, LinkedIn, portfolio, etc.)
sub_fields.description: Builder Credentials:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposer and all team members are in good standing with prior Catalyst projects.
sub_fields.description: Catalyst Standing:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal clearly defines the problem and the value of the on-chain utility.
sub_fields.description: Problem & Use Case:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the primary goal of the proposal is a working prototype deployed on at least a Cardano testnet.
sub_fields.description: Tangible Prototype:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal outlines a credible and clear technical plan and architecture.
sub_fields.description: Technical Approach:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget and timeline (≤ 12 months) are realistic for the proposed work.
sub_fields.description: Realistic Scope:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes a community engagement and feedback plan to amplify prototype adoption with the Cardano ecosystem.
sub_fields.description: Community Engagement:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget is for future development only; excludes retroactive funding, incentives, giveaways, re-granting, or sub-treasuries.
